alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 27 at 5:48PM MST until January 28 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches below 3000 feet, and 4 to 6 inches above 3000 feet. Winds will increase overnight with gusts as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Eastport, Clark Fork, Sandpoint, Priest River, Bonners Ferry, Athol, and Schweitzer Mountain Road. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Winds increasing overnight will lead to concerns of blowing snow across the roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
